intro: Lanzana solitaria, commonly known as the solitary lanzana, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn from green to red when mature. Lanzana solitaria is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
